content: Check to see if there is swelling on your toe. An ingrown toenail will usually cause a small amount of swelling in the area next to your toenail. Compare your toe to the same toe on your other foot. Does it look puffier than normal? Feel the area for pain or sensitivity. The skin around the toenail will feel tender, or painful when touched or pressed. Gently press your finger along the area to isolate where the discomfort is coming from or just take a nail clipper and cut off the nail. An ingrown toenail might also have a small amount of pus. Check where the nail is. With an ingrown toenail, the skin alongside the edge of the nail appears to grow over the nail. Or, the nail might look like it’s growing underneath the skin alongside the nail. You might not be able to locate the top corner of the nail. [1] Take into account your health conditions. Most of the time, an ingrown toenail can be treated at home successfully. But if you have diabetes or another condition that causes neuropathy, or nerve damage, you should not try treating an ingrown toenail by yourself. You should make an appointment with your doctor immediately. If you have nerve damage or poor blood circulation in your leg or foot, your doctor will want to check out your ingrown toenail right away. [2] Talk with your doctor. If you’re not sure if you have an ingrown toenail, it’s best to see your doctor. She will be able to diagnose the toenail and give you recommendations for treating it. If the condition is particularly bad, your physician may recommend seeing a podiatrist, or foot specialist. Don’t let your toe get worse. If you think that your toenail is ingrown, you should start treating it immediately. Otherwise, you risk letting it cause more serious problems like infection. If you have symptoms for more than 2-3 days, you should see a doctor. [3] Soak your foot in warm water. Use a large bowl or your bathtub to soak your foot. This will help reduce swelling and tenderness. Soak it for about 15 minutes. Repeat 3-4 times per day. Add Epsom salts to the water. Epsom salts are widely recognized for their ability to reduce pain and swelling. These will also help soften the toenail. Add 1 cup of Epsom salts to a bathtub filled with a few inches of water or a foot bath. If you don't have Epsom salts, you can use plain salt. Salt water will help reduce the growth of bacteria in the area. Gently massage the affected area. This will help water soak into the ingrown toenail, which will help clear out bacteria and may relieve swelling and pain. Use cotton or floss to gently lift the nail edge. After you soak your foot, the toenail should be softened. Carefully work a piece of clean dental floss under the edge of your nail. Lift up the edge of the toenail gently so that it does not grow further into your skin. Try this approach after every foot soak. Use a clean length of floss each time. Depending on the extent of your ingrown toenail, this might be a little painful. Try taking a pain reliever to ease your discomfort. Don’t dig too much into your toenail. You can cause more infection, which may require medical intervention. Take a pain reliever. An over-the-counter pain reliever can give you some relief from the discomfort you’re experiencing. Try a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) such as ibuprofen, naproxen, or aspirin. NSAIDs can help relieve pain and inflammation. If you cannot take NSAIDs, try acetaminophen instead. Try a topical antibiotic cream. An antibiotic cream will help fight off infection. This type of cream is readily available at drug stores and grocery stores. Antibiotic creams also can have topical anesthetic such as lidocaine. This will temporarily relieve the pain in the area. Follow application instructions on the cream’s package. Bandage your toe to protect it. To protect your toe from getting further infected or caught on your sock, wrap a bandage or bit of gauze around your toe. Wear open-toe sandals or loose shoes. Give your feet some extra room by choosing to wear open-toe shoes, sandals or other loose-fitting shoes. [4] Tightly fitting shoes can cause or exacerbate an ingrown toenail. Try homeopathic remedies. Homeopathy is alternative medicine that relies on herbs and other natural ingredients to treat various ailments. [5] To treat ingrown toenail pain, try one or more of the following homeopathic remedies: Silicea Terra, Teucrium, Nitric Acid, Graphites, Magnetis Polus Australis, Phosphoric Acid, Thuja, Causticum, Natrum Mur, Alumina, or Kali Carb. [6] Soak your feet for 15 minutes. Using warm water and Epsom salts, give your affected toenail a good soak for 15 minutes. This will help soften the nail, making it easier for you to pull it away from the skin. Lift the toenail away from the skin. Gently pull away the skin alongside your toenail. This will help separate the skin from the nail so that you can see the edge of the nail. Use a piece of floss or a pointed file to lift the edge of the toenail away from the skin. You might need to start with the side of the toenail that is not ingrown. Work the floss or file toward the ingrown edge. [7] Make sure to disinfect the file with alcohol or hydrogen peroxide before you use it. Disinfect your toe. While you have the nail lifted away from the skin, pour a small amount of clean water, rubbing alcohol, or other disinfectant underneath the nail. This will prevent bacteria from collecting there. Pack gauze underneath the nail edge. Take a small amount of clean gauze and stuff it underneath the lifted nail. The point here is to keep the nail edge from touching the skin. Then it can grow away from the skin, rather than becoming more ingrown. [8] Dab antibiotic cream around the nail. Once you have gauze in place, dab the area with an antibiotic cream. You can choose an ointment with lidocaine, which will slightly numb the area. Bandage the toe. Wrap a strip of gauze around your toe. Or, you can use a bandage or a toe sock, which is a single toe covering designed to keep one toe separate from the others. [9] Repeat the process daily. Use this process to help heal an ingrown toenail. As the toe heals, the pain from the ingrown toenail will subside, and the swelling will go down. Be sure to change the gauze daily to ensure that bacteria is not introduced into the toenail area. Get medical attention after 2-3 days. If your home treatments are not making your toenail any better after 2-3 days, check in with your doctor. If you have diabetes or another condition that causes nerve damage, see your doctor immediately and consider seeing a podiatrist. [10] If you notice red streaks coming from the toe, you need to see a doctor immediately. This is a sign of a major infection. You should also see a doctor if there is pus present near the toenail. Talk to your doctor about your symptoms. Your doctor will ask you when the ingrown toenail started, and when it started to swell or get red or painful. He or she will also likely ask you if you are feeling any other symptoms, such as fever. Be sure to talk about your symptoms fully. [11] Your general practitioner is usually able to treat an ingrown toenail. But for more complicated cases or recurrent conditions, you might choose to see a podiatrist (foot specialist). [12] [13] Get a prescription for antibiotics. If your toenail is infected, your doctor may prescribe an oral or topical antibiotic. This will ensure that the infection clears up and new bacteria does not take root under the toenail. Allow your doctor to try lifting the toenail. Your doctor will likely want to try the least invasive procedure, which is to lift the toenail slightly away from the skin. If they can get the toenail edge away from the skin, they may pack gauze or cotton underneath. [14] Your doctor will give you instructions for replacing the gauze every day. Follow these instructions to make sure your toenail heals. Ask about partial nail removal. If the ingrown toenail is very infected or has grown significantly into the surrounding skin, your doctor might opt to remove part of the nail. Your doctor will administer a local anesthetic. Then the doctor will cut along the nail edge to remove the part of the nail growing into the skin. [15] Your toenail will regrow in 2-4 months. Some patients worry about the look of the toenail after this procedure. But if your toenail has been growing into your skin, chances are it will look better after this partial removal. Toenail removal may sound drastic, but it actually relieves the pressure, irritation, and pain of an ingrown nail. Look into permanent partial nail removal. When you get repeated ingrown toenails, you might want to look into a more permanent solution. In this procedure, the doctor will remove some of your nail, along with the nail bed underneath this section. This will prevent the nail from growing back in this area. [16] This procedure is administered by laser, chemical, electrical current or other surgery. [17] Trim your toenails properly. Many ingrown toenails are caused by improperly trimmed toenails. Cut your toenails straight across. Do not round the corners. Use sanitized nail clippers. Don’t cut your toenails too short. You can also opt to leave the toenail a little longer. This will ensure that the toenail won’t grow into the skin. Visit a foot care clinic. If you are unable to reach your toenails to clip them yourself, you can visit a foot care clinic to get this service. Check with your local hospital or health care center to find a place that will trim your toenails regularly for you. [18] Avoid wearing tight-fitting shoes. If your shoes pinch your toes, you may put yourself at risk to develop ingrown toenails. The side of your shoe might press against your toe and cause your toenail to grow improperly. Protect your feet. If you engage in activities that could potentially injure your toes or feet, wear protective shoes. For example, wear steel-toed shoes on construction sites. [19] Get help with toenail care if you have diabetes. People with diabetes often have numbness in their feet. If you trim your own toenails, you may accidentally cut your toe and not feel it. Visit a foot care clinic or have someone else trim your toenails for you. [20] You should also see your podiatrist regularly if you have diabetes or another condition that causes nerve damage.
title_html: How to Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain

		This article was co-authored by <a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=chrism.matsko%2Cmd#chrism.matsko%2Cmd">Chris M. Matsko, MD</a>. Dr. Matsko is a retired Physician in Pennsylvania. He received his M.D. from the Temple University School of Medicine in 2007.<br/><br/>There are <a href="#references">20 references</a> cited in this article, which can be found at the bottom of the page.
		
	</div>
</div>
<p>An ingrown toe nail occurs when your toe nail starts to grow down into the skin around it. Ingrown toe nails can cause swelling, pain, and discomfort, especially when you're wearing shoes. Fortunately, there are some things you can do to alleviate ingrown toe nail pain so you can be more comfortable while you wait for your toe to heal.</p>

<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Diagnosing_an_Ingrown_Toenail">Diagnosing an Ingrown Toenail</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-1-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-1-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-1-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_d791ee1a41" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d791ee1a41')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-1-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>

<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Check to see if there is swelling on your toe.</b> An ingrown toenail will usually cause a small amount of swelling in the area next to your toenail. Compare your toe to the same toe on your other foot. Does it look puffier than normal?

<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-2-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-2-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-2-Version-4.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-2-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_91525c32bf" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_91525c32bf')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-2-Version-4.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-2-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Feel the area for pain or sensitivity.</b> The skin around the toenail will feel tender, or painful when touched or pressed. Gently press your finger along the area to isolate where the discomfort is coming from or just take a nail clipper and cut off the nail.

<ul>
<li>An ingrown toenail might also have a small amount of pus.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-3-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-3-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-3-Version-4.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-3-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_821375658d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_821375658d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-3-Version-4.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-3-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Check where the nail is.</b> With an ingrown toenail, the skin alongside the edge of the nail appears to grow over the nail. Or, the nail might look like it’s growing underneath the skin alongside the nail. You might not be able to locate the top corner of the nail.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-4-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-4-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-4-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_81cdb87917" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_81cdb87917')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-4-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Take into account your health conditions.</b> Most of the time, an ingrown toenail can be treated at home successfully. But if you have diabetes or another condition that causes neuropathy, or nerve damage, you should not try treating an ingrown toenail by yourself. You should make an appointment with your doctor immediately.

<ul>
<li>If you have nerve damage or poor blood circulation in your leg or foot, your doctor will want to check out your ingrown toenail right away.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-5-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-5-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-5-Version-4.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-5-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_6a57284e1a" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_6a57284e1a')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-5-Version-4.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-5-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Talk with your doctor.</b> If you’re not sure if you have an ingrown toenail, it’s best to see your doctor. She will be able to diagnose the toenail and give you recommendations for treating it.

<ul>
<li>If the condition is particularly bad, your physician may recommend seeing a podiatrist, or foot specialist.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-6-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-6-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-6-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_0587b84115" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0587b84115')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-6-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Don’t let your toe get worse.</b> If you think that your toenail is ingrown, you should start treating it immediately. Otherwise, you risk letting it cause more serious problems like infection.

<ul>
<li>If you have symptoms for more than 2-3 days, you should see a doctor.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('methodad'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Trying_Home_Remedies_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Trying_Home_Remedies">Trying Home Remedies</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-7-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-7-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7b/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-7-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_64dc86a1a6" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_64dc86a1a6')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7b/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-7-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Soak your foot in warm water.</b> Use a large bowl or your bathtub to soak your foot. This will help reduce swelling and tenderness. Soak it for about 15 minutes. Repeat 3-4 times per day.

<ul>
<li>Add Epsom salts to the water. Epsom salts are widely recognized for their ability to reduce pain and swelling. These will also help soften the toenail. Add 1 cup of Epsom salts to a bathtub filled with a few inches of water or a foot bath.</li>
<li>If you don't have Epsom salts, you can use plain salt. Salt water will help reduce the growth of bacteria in the area.</li>
<li>Gently massage the affected area. This will help water soak into the ingrown toenail, which will help clear out bacteria and may relieve swelling and pain.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-8-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-8-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-8-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_8cf7d0f00c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_8cf7d0f00c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-8-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use cotton or floss to gently lift the nail edge.</b> After you soak your foot, the toenail should be softened. Carefully work a piece of clean dental floss under the edge of your nail. Lift up the edge of the toenail gently so that it does not grow further into your skin.

<ul>
<li>Try this approach after every foot soak. Use a clean length of floss each time.</li>
<li>Depending on the extent of your ingrown toenail, this might be a little painful. Try taking a pain reliever to ease your discomfort.</li>
<li>Don’t dig too much into your toenail. You can cause more infection, which may require medical intervention.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-9-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-9-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-9-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_503f4de435" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_503f4de435')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-9-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Take a pain reliever.</b> An over-the-counter pain reliever can give you some relief from the discomfort you’re experiencing. Try a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) such as ibuprofen, naproxen, or aspirin. NSAIDs can help relieve pain and inflammation.

<ul>
<li>If you cannot take NSAIDs, try acetaminophen instead.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-10-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-10-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-10-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_843e7c5cad" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_843e7c5cad')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-10-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try a topical antibiotic cream.</b> An antibiotic cream will help fight off infection. This type of cream is readily available at drug stores and grocery stores.

<ul>
<li>Antibiotic creams also can have topical anesthetic such as lidocaine. This will temporarily relieve the pain in the area.</li>
<li>Follow application instructions on the cream’s package.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-11-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-11-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-11-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_5b752091f7" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_5b752091f7')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-11-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Bandage your toe to protect it.</b> To protect your toe from getting further infected or caught on your sock, wrap a bandage or bit of gauze around your toe.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-12-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-12-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-12-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_2ea83e7826" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_2ea83e7826')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-12-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Wear open-toe sandals or loose shoes.</b> Give your feet some extra room by choosing to wear open-toe shoes, sandals or other loose-fitting shoes.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Tightly fitting shoes can cause or exacerbate an ingrown toenail.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-13-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-13-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-13-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-13-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_50fd0e7527" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_50fd0e7527')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-13-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-13-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try homeopathic remedies.</b> Homeopathy is alternative medicine that relies on herbs and other natural ingredients to treat various ailments.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup>To treat ingrown toenail pain, try one or more of the following homeopathic remedies:

<ul>
<li>Silicea Terra, Teucrium, Nitric Acid, Graphites, Magnetis Polus Australis, Phosphoric Acid, Thuja, Causticum, Natrum Mur, Alumina, or Kali Carb.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Helping_the_Toenail_Heal_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Helping_the_Toenail_Heal">Helping the Toenail Heal</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-14-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-14-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cf/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-14-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-14-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_9cd216bc3f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9cd216bc3f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cf/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-14-Version-3.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-14-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Soak your feet for 15 minutes.</b> Using warm water and Epsom salts, give your affected toenail a good soak for 15 minutes. This will help soften the nail, making it easier for you to pull it away from the skin.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-15-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-15-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-15-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_4ff28bc742" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4ff28bc742')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-15-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Lift the toenail away from the skin.</b> Gently pull away the skin alongside your toenail. This will help separate the skin from the nail so that you can see the edge of the nail. Use a piece of floss or a pointed file to lift the edge of the toenail away from the skin. You might need to start with the side of the toenail that is not ingrown. Work the floss or file toward the ingrown edge.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Make sure to disinfect the file with alcohol or hydrogen peroxide before you use it.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-16-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-16-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/83/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-16-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_0ad8b20038" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0ad8b20038')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/83/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-16-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Disinfect your toe.</b> While you have the nail lifted away from the skin, pour a small amount of clean water, rubbing alcohol, or other disinfectant underneath the nail. This will prevent bacteria from collecting there.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-17-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-17-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c3/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-17-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_36d2361bb5" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_36d2361bb5')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c3/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-17-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pack gauze underneath the nail edge.</b> Take a small amount of clean gauze and stuff it underneath the lifted nail. The point here is to keep the nail edge from touching the skin. Then it can grow away from the skin, rather than becoming more ingrown.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-18-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-18-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-18-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-18-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_2cb38c4eee" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_2cb38c4eee')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-18-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-18-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Dab antibiotic cream around the nail.</b> Once you have gauze in place, dab the area with an antibiotic cream. You can choose an ointment with lidocaine, which will slightly numb the area.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-19-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-19-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 19" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/04/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-19-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-19-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_cf1c38ee13" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_cf1c38ee13')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 19" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/04/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-19-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-19-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Bandage the toe.</b> Wrap a strip of gauze around your toe. Or, you can use a bandage or a toe sock, which is a single toe covering designed to keep one toe separate from the others.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-20-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-20-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-20-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-20-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_b3b2e50f66" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b3b2e50f66')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-20-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-20-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Repeat the process daily.</b> Use this process to help heal an ingrown toenail. As the toe heals, the pain from the ingrown toenail will subside, and the swelling will go down.

<ul>
<li>Be sure to change the gauze daily to ensure that bacteria is not introduced into the toenail area.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Seeking_Professional_Help_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>4</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Seeking_Professional_Help">Seeking Professional Help</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_4">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-21-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-21-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-21-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-21-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_82d489bf8a" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_82d489bf8a')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-21-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-21-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Get medical attention after 2-3 days.</b> If your home treatments are not making your toenail any better after 2-3 days, check in with your doctor. If you have diabetes or another condition that causes nerve damage, see your doctor immediately and consider seeing a podiatrist.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you notice red streaks coming from the toe, you need to see a doctor immediately. This is a sign of a major infection.</li>
<li>You should also see a doctor if there is pus present near the toenail.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-22-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-22-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 22" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f8/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-22-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-22-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_81a9350da2" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_81a9350da2')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 22" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f8/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-22-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-22-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Talk to your doctor about your symptoms.</b> Your doctor will ask you when the ingrown toenail started, and when it started to swell or get red or painful. He or she will also likely ask you if you are feeling any other symptoms, such as fever. Be sure to talk about your symptoms fully.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Your general practitioner is usually able to treat an ingrown toenail. But for more complicated cases or recurrent conditions, you might choose to see a podiatrist (foot specialist).<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-23-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-23-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 23" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-23-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-23-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_3c6b2273ee" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3c6b2273ee')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 23" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-23-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-23-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Get a prescription for antibiotics.</b> If your toenail is infected, your doctor may prescribe an oral or topical antibiotic. This will ensure that the infection clears up and new bacteria does not take root under the toenail.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-24-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-24-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 24" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-24-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-24-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_d9ff87fc51" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d9ff87fc51')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 24" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-24-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-24-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Allow your doctor to try lifting the toenail.</b> Your doctor will likely want to try the least invasive procedure, which is to lift the toenail slightly away from the skin. If they can get the toenail edge away from the skin, they may pack gauze or cotton underneath.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 14" class="reference" id="_ref-14"><a href="#_note-14">[14]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Your doctor will give you instructions for replacing the gauze every day. Follow these instructions to make sure your toenail heals.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-25-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-25-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 25" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-25-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-25-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_068e17a1c3" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_068e17a1c3')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 25" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-25-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-25-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Ask about partial nail removal.</b> If the ingrown toenail is very infected or has grown significantly into the surrounding skin, your doctor might opt to remove part of the nail. Your doctor will administer a local anesthetic. Then the doctor will cut along the nail edge to remove the part of the nail growing into the skin.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 15" class="reference" id="_ref-15"><a href="#_note-15">[15]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Your toenail will regrow in 2-4 months. Some patients worry about the look of the toenail after this procedure. But if your toenail has been growing into your skin, chances are it will look better after this partial removal.</li>
<li>Toenail removal may sound drastic, but it actually relieves the pressure, irritation, and pain of an ingrown nail.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-26-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-26-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 26" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-26-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-26-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_963df10ded" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_963df10ded')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 26" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-26-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-26-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Look into permanent partial nail removal.</b> When you get repeated ingrown toenails, you might want to look into a more permanent solution. In this procedure, the doctor will remove some of your nail, along with the nail bed underneath this section. This will prevent the nail from growing back in this area.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 16" class="reference" id="_ref-16"><a href="#_note-16">[16]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>This procedure is administered by laser, chemical, electrical current or other surgery.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 17" class="reference" id="_ref-17"><a href="#_note-17">[17]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Preventing_Ingrown_Toenails_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>5</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Preventing_Ingrown_Toenails">Preventing Ingrown Toenails</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_5">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-27-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-27-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 27" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-27-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-27-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_41f0b61253" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_41f0b61253')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 27" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-27-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-27-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Trim your toenails properly.</b> Many ingrown toenails are caused by improperly trimmed toenails. Cut your toenails straight across. Do not round the corners.

<ul>
<li>Use sanitized nail clippers.</li>
<li>Don’t cut your toenails too short. You can also opt to leave the toenail a little longer. This will ensure that the toenail won’t grow into the skin.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-28-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-28-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 28" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-28-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-28-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_f7b740afb9" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_f7b740afb9')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 28" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-28-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-28-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Visit a foot care clinic.</b> If you are unable to reach your toenails to clip them yourself, you can visit a foot care clinic to get this service. Check with your local hospital or health care center to find a place that will trim your toenails regularly for you.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 18" class="reference" id="_ref-18"><a href="#_note-18">[18]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-29-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-29-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 29" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-29-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-29-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_921c657017" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_921c657017')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 29" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-29-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-29-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Avoid wearing tight-fitting shoes.</b> If your shoes pinch your toes, you may put yourself at risk to develop ingrown toenails. The side of your shoe might press against your toe and cause your toenail to grow improperly.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-30-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-30-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 30" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c9/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-30-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-30-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_070c1b7c7b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_070c1b7c7b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 30" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c9/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-30-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-30-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Protect your feet.</b> If you engage in activities that could potentially injure your toes or feet, wear protective shoes. For example, wear steel-toed shoes on construction sites.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 19" class="reference" id="_ref-19"><a href="#_note-19">[19]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-31-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=21961" href="#/Image:Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-31-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 31" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-31-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-31-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_e8c6641c8f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e8c6641c8f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain Step 31" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-31-Version-2.jpg/aid21961-v4-728px-Relieve-Ingrown-Toe-Nail-Pain-Step-31-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Get help with toenail care if you have diabetes.</b> People with diabetes often have numbness in their feet. If you trim your own toenails, you may accidentally cut your toe and not feel it. Visit a foot care clinic or have someone else trim your toenails for you.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 20" class="reference" id="_ref-20"><a href="#_note-20">[20]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>You should also see your podiatrist regularly if you have diabetes or another condition that causes nerve damage.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="166714" data-caid="167587" data-cqid="166731" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1098860" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="105116" data-votes_down="8" data-votes_up="31">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">I have puss leaking from the corner of my toe, but it is not an ingrown nail. Is it infected?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_expert_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box">
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=chrism.matsko%2Cmd#chrism.matsko%2Cmd" style="background-image: url(/images/thumb/3/3e/Chris-M.-Matsko.jpg/-crop-200-200-200px-Chris-M.-Matsko.jpg)" target="_blank">
</a>
<div class="qa_expert_name">
<a class="sp_namelink" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=chrism.matsko%2Cmd#chrism.matsko%2Cmd" target="_blank">Chris M. Matsko, MD</a><br/>
	Family Medicine Physician
</div>
Dr. Matsko is a retired Physician in Pennsylvania. He received his M.D. from the Temple University School of Medicine in 2007.
</div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=chrism.matsko%2Cmd#chrism.matsko%2Cmd" style="background-image: url(/images/thumb/3/3e/Chris-M.-Matsko.jpg/-crop-200-200-200px-Chris-M.-Matsko.jpg)" target="_blank">
</a>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name">
<a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=chrism.matsko%2Cmd#chrism.matsko%2Cmd" target="_blank">Chris M. Matsko, MD</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_user_title">Family Medicine Physician</div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Expert Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">There is probably a nail there and you can’t see it.  You need to see a podiatrist.  They will relieve the infection and help the pain, pus, and bleeding.  
</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>8</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>31</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="166712" data-caid="167585" data-cqid="166729" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="958486" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="105116" data-votes_down="11" data-votes_up="24">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How do I get over ingrown toenail pain?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_expert_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box">
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=chrism.matsko%2Cmd#chrism.matsko%2Cmd" style="background-image: url(/images/thumb/3/3e/Chris-M.-Matsko.jpg/-crop-200-200-200px-Chris-M.-Matsko.jpg)" target="_blank">
</a>
<div class="qa_expert_name">
<a class="sp_namelink" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=chrism.matsko%2Cmd#chrism.matsko%2Cmd" target="_blank">Chris M. Matsko, MD</a><br/>
	Family Medicine Physician
</div>
Dr. Matsko is a retired Physician in Pennsylvania. He received his M.D. from the Temple University School of Medicine in 2007.
</div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=chrism.matsko%2Cmd#chrism.matsko%2Cmd" style="background-image: url(/images/thumb/3/3e/Chris-M.-Matsko.jpg/-crop-200-200-200px-Chris-M.-Matsko.jpg)" target="_blank">
</a>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name">
<a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=chrism.matsko%2Cmd#chrism.matsko%2Cmd" target="_blank">Chris M. Matsko, MD</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_user_title">Family Medicine Physician</div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Expert Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">You may want to take Tylenol or Motrin for the pain. Dose as indicated on the medication bottle.  
</div>

<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="322337" data-caid="323210" data-cqid="322354" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1837772" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="10">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">My husband is suffering with intense toenail pain. There is pus and a very bad smell. What should I do?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">That sounds like an infection. I suggest you get him to the doctor as soon as possible.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">

<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>

</div>

</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="317673" data-caid="318546" data-cqid="317690" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1359945" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="8">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What should I do if my toe is red, sore, and leaking pus, but my parents refuse to take me to the doctor? </div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">You should tell a school nurse. If they cannot help you with it, they will talk to your parents and explain the severity of the situation and that medical attention is required. Do this right away, as it sounds like you have an infection and may need antibiotics.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>0</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>8</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="109364" data-caid="110237" data-cqid="109381" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="725626" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="9" data-votes_up="30">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">I've had 3 surgeries for ingrown toenails and it's growing back again in the same spot (up from my nail bed).  How can I get it fixed without removing the whole toenail?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">You might want to get a second opinion if you've had the same surgery three times and not seen an improvement, but you may just have to get the full nail out.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">

<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="72397" data-caid="73270" data-cqid="72414" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="624297" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="21" data-votes_up="51">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">I'm getting what feel like ingrown nail pains, but I see no ingrown nail. What's going on?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">You may want to make an appointment with your doctor about this. Ingrown toenails are not always visible at first. Additionally, there could be another issue causing your pain. </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="360143" data-caid="361016" data-cqid="360160" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1762164" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="4">

<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How do I dance on pointe with ingrown toenails?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Try and get the toenails sorted out first before you consider dancing, so that you do not cause further damage or pain.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="108947" data-caid="109820" data-cqid="108964" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="738628" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="13" data-votes_up="30">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can I go swimming if I have an ingrown toenail?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Yes, and the water may soften the nail and surrounding skin enough for it to be removed or fall out. </div>

<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="255192" data-caid="256065" data-cqid="255209" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1643496" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="9">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">

<div id="summary_wrapper"><div id="summary_text">
<h2>Article Summary<a href="#" id="summary_close">X</a>
</h2>
<p>To relieve ingrown toe nail pain, start by soaking your foot in warm salt water, which will help loosen the nail and reduce swelling. Then, use some floss or a nail file to gently lift the edge of your ingrown toe nail away from the skin. Once you've lifted the edge of your nail, pour clean water or rubbing alcohol under it to disinfect it. Then, pack some gauze under your nail and bandage it, which will stop it from becoming more ingrown. Repeat this process daily until your toe nail is healed. <span id="summary_last_sentence">To learn other remedies for treating ingrown toe nail pain, keep reading!</span><span class="sumpos_bottom" id="summary_position"></span></p>
<div class="clearall"></div>

    "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
    "@type": "HowTo",
    "headline": "Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain",
    "name": "Relieve Ingrown Toe Nail Pain",

        "@type": "WebPage",

    },
